conclusion: To determine the time taken for the small ball to move from point B to point C, we need to analyze the projectile motion of the ball.

A semicylinder with radius R=0.75m is placed on a horizontal ground. A small ball is thrown horizontally from point B directly above point A at the left end of the cylinder, and it just grazes past point C on the semicylinder. O is the center of the semicylinder, and the angle between OC and the horizontal direction is 53°.

Identify the horizontal and vertical components of the displacement: The horizontal distance from point B to point C is the horizontal component of the displacement. The vertical distance from point B to point C is the vertical component of the displacement.

premise: The angle between OC and the horizontal direction is 53°. The radius of the semicylinder is R = 0.75 m.
conclusion: The horizontal coordinate of point C is R cos 53°.

premise: The angle between OC and the horizontal direction is 53°. The radius of the semicylinder is R = 0.75 m.
conclusion: The vertical coordinate of point C is R sin 53°.
Calculate the horizontal and vertical components of the displacement.
Horizontal component: x = R cos 53° = 0.75 × 0.6 = 0.45 m
Vertical component: y = R sin 53° = 0.75 × 0.8 = 0.60 m
Set up the equations of motion.

premise: The horizontal motion is uniform: x = v₀ t
conclusion: The horizontal motion equation is x = v₀ t

premise: The vertical motion is uniformly accelerated: y = 1/2 g t²
conclusion: The vertical motion equation is y = 1/2 g t²

premise: From the vertical motion equation: 0.60 = 1/2 × 10 × t²
